test1.title: Key Word Transformations
test1.instructions: For questions 25-30, complete the second sentence so that it has a similar meaning to the first sentence, using the word given. Do not change the word given. You must use between two and five words, including the word given.

questions.original: I haven't been to the cinema for two months.
questions.incomplete: The _____ to the cinema was two months ago.
questions.explanation: Use 'last time' + past simple to express when something happened most recently.

questions.original: She's too young to understand the problem.
questions.incomplete: She isn't _____ to understand the problem.

questions.original: They might cancel the meeting because of the storm.
questions.incomplete: The meeting might _____ because of the storm.
questions.explanation: Use passive voice 'be + past participle' after modal verbs.

questions.original: I prefer reading books to watching television.
questions.incomplete: I would _____ books than watch television.
questions.explanation: Use 'would rather + base verb + than + base verb' to express preference.

questions.original: It's not necessary for you to come early.
questions.explanation: Use 'don't have to' to express lack of necessity.

questions.original: The teacher made us study harder for the exam.
questions.incomplete: We _____ study harder for the exam.
questions.explanation: Convert active 'made + person + verb' to passive 'were made to + verb'.

test2.title: Advanced Transformations
test2.instructions: For questions 25-30, complete the second sentence so that it has a similar meaning to the first sentence, using the word given. Do not change the word given. You must use between two and five words, including the word given.

questions.original: I wish I hadn't told him the secret.
questions.explanation: Use 'regret + -ing' for past actions you wish you hadn't done.

questions.original: Despite working hard, she didn't pass the exam.
questions.incomplete: _____ hard, she didn't pass the exam.

questions.original: The car was so expensive that I couldn't buy it.
questions.incomplete: The car was too expensive for me _____.
questions.explanation: Use 'too + adjective + for + person + to + verb'.

questions.original: Nobody expected the team to win.
questions.incomplete: It came _____ when the team won.
questions.explanation: Use 'come as a surprise' meaning to be unexpected.

questions.original: I'm sure he didn't steal the money.
questions.explanation: Use 'can't have + past participle' for strong negative deduction about the past.

questions.original: The concert was cancelled due to bad weather.
questions.incomplete: The concert was _____ due to bad weather.
questions.explanation: Use 'put off' meaning to postpone or cancel.

metadata.focus: modals of deduction, conditionals, phrasal verbs
